alert.note: Alert for Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 1:26PM EST until December 11 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow will range between 2 to 4 inches between 1,000 and 3,000 feet with 4 to 8 inches above 3,000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Virginia Blue Ridge and Central Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 6 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute with snow covered and slippery surfaces. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to snow this evening between 9 and 11 PM with temperatures rapidly falling below freezing. The combination of snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility below one-half mile at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge
